website_summaries.verdict: Towering above others in terms of quality and craftsmanship, this reputable product is the best on the market.
cons: Some owners wish that the snow disks had a larger diameter

customer_reviews.title: Save your wrists!
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of Nordic walking on sidewalks and other paved surfaces, and my other trekking poles - also Black Diamond, and great for the trails - were producing so much vibration that my wrists and even thumb were beginning to hurt. The Pro Shock Trekking Pole has a sort of air cushion at the first joint of the pole that works beautifully to prevent the vibrations from traveling up the shaft and into your hands and arms. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: New Version has Flimsy Lower Plastic Part
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! I loved my previous pair but new design includes cheap plastic connection for lower section. Plastic component had two sections that are factory connected by small ribbed snap together segment that is only maybe 1/64 inch of plastic holding it together. No strength what so ever. Broke on second day of use.
customer_reviews.author: Montana

customer_reviews.title: Great poles, lower locking mechanism concerning.
customer_reviews.text: These are highly rated poles, one of the best shock-absorption systems out there. They are light. The only problem is forsee is the new lower locking mechanism seems a bit iffy. It could fail. They should put their tried and true locking mechanism on both parts of the pole-it doesn't save much time!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M. Guglielmo

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Quality and Functionality
customer_reviews.text: I have been a 50+ mile per week walker for years and always use at least one trek pole. The Black Diamond with ‘pro shock’ is an excellent pole by all measure of quality and functionality. The pro shock provides a level of comfort which for me will always be a ‘must have’.
customer_reviews.author: MalvernBound

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful sticks!! The shock function makes a big difference. Just got back from hiking southern Germany and these made a huge difference. For TSA purposes, can not take these in your carry on, however they do collapse down nicely and fit in luggage.
customer_reviews.author: jbuco315

customer_reviews.title: Nice poles, good I bought than
customer_reviews.text: Nice and strong, while also feeling light enough. The small amount of shock bumper is enough to feel and I think is worth it for a little hand stress reduction
customer_reviews.author: brad

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for your hike
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and very helpful over rough terrain. Clamps are metal not plastic
customer_reviews.author: Friarman

customer_reviews.title: Size matter
customer_reviews.text: This size is bit too long for us when travel. I am thought it would be smaller. I will give it a try
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: top quality item at a blow out price
customer_reviews.text: top quality construction and appearance. The amazon price is a bargain . can be used instead of crutches.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WHY DID THEY GO AND RUIN A GREAT POLE
customer_reviews.text: The older version of these poles had the upper and lower section Flick-locks so you could adjust the upper and lower sections. These new ones have the adjustment only on the upper section, and something called "Smash lock" on the lower, which is not adjustable. It only locks fully extended. Why is this a problem? Well, I am 5 foot 7 and these are way too long for me when the top is fully collapsed and I am climbing uphill on steep terrain. Very disappointing design.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B

product_meta.title: Black Diamond Trail Pro Shock Trekking Poles
product_meta.description: As Black Diamond's lightweight trail series trekking pole designed for four-season, on-trail versatility, the Trail Shock Pro features the terrain-absorbing benefits of Control Shock Technology, combined with the quick deployment and collapsibility of the new SmashLock quick-release system. The SmashLock mechanism allows you to quickly deploy the telescoping pole and lock it into place with an easy-to-hear click (keep the FlickLock Pro closed during deployment). Then, with the FlickLock Pro open, swiftly and firmly press the tip of the pole into the trail to release the SmashLock for a quick collapse.
feature_bullets: SmashLock quick Release technology for quick deployment and collapsibility
New Flick Lock Pro adjustability—now featuring aluminum construction that’s lighter and easier to use
Updated soft-foam grip with solution strap for added security and better handling
Interchangeable carbide Tech Tips, 38mm Trekking Basket
Ski compatible ferrule will accept 100mm powder baskets for deep snow
